moves.2. a3: This is a waste of a move. It doesn't help develop any pieces or attack the center of the board. The only thing this move does is prevent the bishop from going to b4 later.
moves.5. Bc4: Another waste of tempo. The bishop moved twice for no reason.
moves.5... d6: I would have played 5...Nxe4 6.Nxe4. and then d5. It gives black a good position. d6 only prevents the dark squared bishop from getting into a better position.
moves.6. Nd5: A move that doesen't acomplish anything. Another weak move from white.
moves.6... Nxd5: That pawn on e4 was just wating to be taken. Oh well.
moves.8. Qf3: Attempting a mate on f7. The mate can be stoped many ways.
moves.9. Qxf7#: White wins with a simple mate early in the game. Remember that this game was played in the casual section of the tournament.
